text: REVISION WITH UNLABELLED PHOTOMICROGRAPHS ➢ Study each photomicrograph and electron micrographs carefully. ➢ Identify the organ/structure in each photomicrograph and electron micrograph. ➢ Identify what structures are seen within the photomicrographs and electron micrographs. ➢ Revise the associated function of each identified organ/structure. ➢ Identify the different layers, areas, cavities, and lumen are shown within each photomicrograph and electron micrograph. ➢ Provide classifications where suitable for all primary tissues identified. ➢ Revise the contents, secretions, stimulation, substances, and cells that are associated with layers and areas identified above. ➢ Make annotations on the images to indicate the size, function and location of each structure/organ identified.
